conbody.p:
Despite the many definitions and types of startups, they all share a few key features:
Innovation: Startups don’t copy what’s already out there; they offer a unique product or service.
Scalability: They aim to create a business model that can be implemented in various markets, ideally worldwide.
Potentially Fast Growth: Startups are expected to grow quickly, offering large and speedy returns on investment.
Technological approach: Using the latest available technology (e.g. AI), improving expired patents or other technological and scientific solutions.
Short Operating History: Typically, startups have been in operation for up to five years on average.
Risk: Startups are high-risk ventures with uncertain returns on investment.
